result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy D Trussell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Roy D Trussell was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roy D Trussell is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Roy D Trussell was found guilty of Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roy D Trussell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Roy D Trussell in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:59 PM. Court summarizes file activities. Court has no written response in regards to Kennedy's briefs and will give oral argument. Kennedy - also has asked for Court to take judicial notice of document. Kennedy calls Sheriff John Dennee. Dennee sworn in. Direct exam by Kennedy at 3:01 PM. Kennedy and witness review documents that the witness has brought with him at the request of Kennedy. Kennedy offers exhibit #1 - Forest County Humane Society Contract. Kennedy moves for receipt of exhibit #1. State objects for stated reasons (lack of proper foundation). Court denies receipt of exhibit #1. Kennedy makes offer of proof for exhibit #1 so it is on the record. Court will allow the Clerk to hold onto the exhibit. State objects for stated reasons. Court hands the exhibit back to Kennedy after making record as to what the exhibit was (3:07 PM). Kennedy again tries to get the exhibit into the record. Court still denies after objection from the State (3:08 PM). Kennedy offers exhibits #2 - minutes from FC Sheriff and Justice Meeting on 3/7/16 and #3 - agenda for FC Sheriff and Justice Meeting on 3/7/16. Kennedy moves for admission of exhibits #2 and #3. State objects - proper foundation not laid. Court receives exhibits #2 and #3. Kennedy offers exhibit #4 - letter from Kennedy to FOSO regarding this case. Kennedy moves to for admission of exhibit #4. Court receives after no objections. Kennedy offers exhibit #5 - letter from FOSO to Kennedy dated 7/14/16. Kennedy moves for admission of exhibit #5. Court receives after no objections. Kennedy offers exhibit #6 - letter to FOSO from Kennedy dated 7/18/16. Kennedy moves for admission of exhibit #6. Court receives exhibit #6 after no objections. Kennedy offers exhibits #7 - letter to DA from Kennedy dated 7/18/16 and #8 - Letter from DA to Kennedy dated 7/16/16. Kennedy offers exhibit #9 - letter from Kennedy to DA dated 7/22/16. Kennedy offers exhibit #10 - letter from Kennedy to FOSO dated 7/25/16. Kennedy moves for admission of exhibit #10. Court receives after no objections. Kennedy offers exhibit #11 - Invoice from FOSO to Kennedy. Kennedy moves for admission of exhibit #11. Court receives after no objections. Kennedy offers exhibit #12 - letter from FOSO to Kennedy dated 7/28/16. Kennedy moves for admission of exhibit #12 after no objections. Court clarifies for the Clerk/record that it has received exhibits #2, #3, #4, #5, #6, #10, #11 and #12. State has standing objection at this point. Court will overrule the objection at this point. No cross exam by State. Dennee excused at 3:16 PM. Court returns exhibits #7, #8 and #9 to Mr. Kennedy as it has not received them and they are part of the filings/briefs provided by Kennedy and hands the clerk the remaining received exhibits. Kennedy has no more witnesses. State has no witnesses. Kennedy asks that the motion for judicial notice be granted for stated reasons. State asks for clarification. Kennedy responds. Court will take judicial notice of the points that Kennedy has asked him to take judicial notice of. Kennedy has no more argument on the motions for new trial and dismissal, will let briefs stand for themself. State makes argument prior to Court's ruling, asking Court to deny the motions. Kennedy responds, makes argument for his motions and asks Court to grant motions.  State responds. Kennedy responds. Court again takes judicial notice of everything that Kennedy has asked him to take judicial notice of plus Sheriff Dennee's testimony. Court makes ruling - states there are two motions, one motion to dismiss and one motion for new trial - denies both motions for stated reasons and will proceed to sentencing the defendant. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 180 day jail term in the FC jail, fine of $2000 plus costs and asks court to follow his recommendation, victim notification has been complied with. Kennedy makes final argument. Trussell makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: Count 1 - 30 days in FC jail with huber privelages, fine $250 plus court costs plus $250 DNA surcharge, must submit DNA, apply bond posted, remainder due with in 60 days. No time served. Must report today. Court advises of firearm restriction, voting rights and right to appeal. Trussell questions court about appealing. Court responds.
Partial Transcript of 7/12/16 proceedings (Cross Exam by DA Simono of defendant)
Second Supplemental Memorandum filed by Defendant
in support of judicially noticing policies of Forest County Sheriff
Guility of count 1 and not guility of count 2

Roy D Trussell appears with his Attorney Robert Kennedy. Charles Simono appears for the State of Wisconsin. Called 8:22 AM. Court asks what issues need to be taken care of. Kennedy not opposed to any of the State's motions from previous jury trial date. State has issues with exhibits Atty. Kennedy has provided that have narrative attached to photos, asked if narratives have been removed. Kennedy has not removed narratives. Court states Kennedy must lay foundation for each photo with narrative attached. State still objects. Court will address during trial if need be. State has not received a witness list from Attorney Kennedy. Kennedy informs court of whom he intends on calling as witnesses. State objects to WV being called as witness for stated reasons. Kennedy does not agree. Court will allow WV to testify. State objects to DF (photographer) being called as a witness for stated reasons. Court will allow DF to testify. State objects to MA as a witness for stated reasonson. Kennedy suggests doing voir dire on this witness or offer immunity. State objects. Court will voire dire before being called as witness. State would like to renew his objection to using the Castle Doctorine; reads case. Kennedy states Judge previously ordered he would not use it. Court agrees, no castle doctorine can be used. Kennedy asks for sequesteration of witness. Court will have all witnesses sequestered. Motion in Liminie to be granted - offered to defendant to make statement by officers. Kennedy states defendant asked for legal counsel and that he would give no further statements at time of arrest. State - defendant declined to give statement at time officers asked for statement. Court - State can open that issue if Kennedy presents it during trial. Kennedy objects to supoena of defendant's wife by the State. State indicates she may be a rebuttle witness. Court will address if need be as trial proceeds. Clerk of court questions if there will be an alternate juror chosen for today's trial. All parties discuss. Court decides no alternate will be needed for today. Kennedy asks to mark exhibit #49 a large exhibit, clerk will do so after motion hearing. Judicial Notice of WI statutes. Adjourned 8:40 AM.
No contact with DeMars family or their property
Sentencing hearing on August 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Continued minutes for jury trial. Kennedy - the defendant does not want to take the lesser included charge. State responds. Court denies the motion to amend count #2 to negligent mistreatment of animals. Kennedy moves to directed verdict and dismissal of count #2 again. Court denies motion on count #2. Kennedy moves for dismissal on count #1, preserving the right. Court denies that motion as well. Court goes thru jury instructions with counsel. Off record at 4:48 PM. Back on record at 5:21 PM. Both counsel have verdicts are are satisfied with the wording of them. Jury instructions are as follows: #100, 115, 1980, 1347, 140, 145, 103, 170, 180, 157, 155, 148, 147, 190, 195, 300, 160, 460, 484, 515, 522 if requested, and 525A. No additional record made prior to jurors entering. Jurors enter courtroom at 5:25 PM. Court instructs jurors (5:25 PM). State makes closing argument (5:41 PM). Kennedy makes closing argument (5:53 PM). State makes rebuttal remarks (6:03 PM.) Court gives final instructions. Bailiffs sworn (6:14 PM) Jurors leave courtroom to deliberate (6:14 PM). Kennedy asks if exhibits go in to jury - Kennedy wants them all to go in. State disagrees. Court - not unless they ask for them, will make decision if an exhibit is requested. Recess at 6:15 PM. Recalled at 7:09 PM with jurors not present. Court - have a note from the jurors that is read on the record. Court asks for thoughts from counsel, counsel responds, Court will inform the jurors that the question is not a matter for them to decide if the question is or isn't. Agreed by counsel. Recess at 7:11 PM. Recalled at 7:40 PM with jurors present. Court has verdict, reads verdict at 7:41 PM - #1 - guilty - "yes", #2 - not guilty. Court polls jury. Counsel satisfied as polled. Court gives final instruction to jurors. Jurors released at 7:45 PM. Back on record at 7:52 PM with jurors not present. Court orders the defendant to surrender all firearms and a deputy needs to go to the defendant's home tonight to collect all firearms. State moves for judgment on verdict. Court enters judgment on verdict on count #1 and acquittal on count #2. Court will increase cash bond to $750.00 and orders the defendant to post an additional $500.00 cash by 10:00 PM tonight. State suggests that the court also modify the conditions of bond to include surrender of all firearms to Forest County Sheriff's Department. Court sets for sentencing hearing on 8/23/16 at 3:00 PM. State not requesting PSI. Kennedy not requesting PSI. Court wants some sort of firearms itemization on the court record today. Defemdamt states that he currently has three rifles in his possession as the other three guns have already been surrendered to FOSO thru bond conditions. Court provides the defendant with a possession of firearms form to have filled out, a deputy will be arriving at the defendant's home somewhere between 10:00 PM and midnight tonight. Adjourned at 8:03 PM.

Defendant Roy D Trussell in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:55 AM. Clerk swears in jurors. Jurors called to voir dire. State introduces self and witnesses. Kennedy introduces self and witnesses. Voir dire begins at 9:00 AM. Panel is picked and sworn at 10:03 AM. Jurors leave courtroom at 10:05 AM. State - objects to any reference to any breed of dog that was referenced by Mr. Kennedy during voir dire. Court responds. Court will allow the jurors to take notes, no questions will be allowed. Recess at 10:09 AM. Back on record at 10:25 AM with jurors present. Court instructs jurors. State makes opening statement (10:32 AM). Kennedy makes opening statement (10:36 AM). State calls Deputy Jason Novak. Novak sworn in at 10:41 AM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (10:43 AM). State offers exhibit #11. Court receives exhibit #11 after no objections (10:47 AM). State publishes exhibit #11 to jury. State offers exhibit #48. Court receives exhibit #48 after no objections (10:49 AM). State offers exhibit #10. Court receives exhibit #10 after no objections (10:51 AM). State offers exhibit #10B - blowup of #10. Court receives exhibit #10B after no objections (10:52 AM). State offers exhibit #58. Court receives exhibit #58 after no objections, published by holding it in front of the jury. Clerk now has possession of exhibit #58. State offers exhibit #12. Court receives exhibit #12 after no objections (11:03 AM). State publishes exhibit #12 to jury. State offers exhibit #14. Court receives after no objections (11:05 AM). State moves exhibit #15. Court receives exhibit #15 after no objections (11:05 AM). State publishes exhibits #14 and #15 to jury. Cross exam by Kennedy at 11:10 AM. Kennedy offers exhibit #59 (originally #48). Court receives exhibit #59 after off-record objection by State (11:12 AM). Kennedy marks exhibit #60 (State's exhibit #13) and offers it. State objects - relevance - overruled (11:17 AM). State objects - relevant - overruled (11:18 AM). State objects - lack of  foundation - re-ask question. State objects - asked and answered - overruled (11:26 AM). State objects - calls for speculation - overruled (answer if possible). Kennedy offers exhibit #47. State objects - not answered that way - sustained (11:28 AM). Re-direct by State at 11:28 AM. Re-cross by Kennedy at 11:31 AM. State - beyond scope of re-direct (11:31 AM). Court agrees but will allow the question. Re-direct by State at 11:32 AM. Novak excused at 11:32 AM. Kennedy offers exhibit #60 and #47 to be received. Court recevies exhibits #60 and #47 after no objections (11:35 AM). Recess at 11:35 AM. Back on record at 1:00 PM with no jurors present. State wants to amend jury instruction/charge to include "negligent" for count #2. Kennedy makes statement in regards to self-defense argument. Discussion held. Court will take that under advisement and will allow the State to make that argument. Kennedy informed by the Clerk that one of his witnesses is not going to make it here due to weather issues. Court will allow that witness to appear telephonically if necessary. Jurors enters courtroom at 1:08 PM. State calls Nicole Demars. Demars sworn in at 1:09 PM. Direct exam by State. State offers exhibit #1. Court receives exhibit #1 after no objections (1:15 PM). State offers exhibit #2. Court receives exhibit #2 after no objections (1:15 PM). State publishes exhibits #1 and #2 to jury after no objections. State offers exhibit #6. Court receives exhibit #6 after no objections (1:19 PM). State offers echibit #17. Court receives echibit #17 after no objections. State publishes exhibits #6 and #17 to jury after no objections. State offers exhibit #9. Court receives exhibit #9 after no objections (1:23 PM). State publishes exhibit #9 after no objections. Cross exam by Kennedy at 1:28 PM. State objects - relevance - sustained (1:29 PM). Kennedy offers exhibits #52, #53, #54 and #55. State objects - lack of foundation laid - sustained at this point (1:30 PM). State objects - asked and answered - sustained (1:33 PM). Re-direct by State at 1:33 PM. Re-cross by Kennedy at 1:35 PM. Demars excused at 1:35 PM. State calls Kevin Demars. Demars sworn in at 1:37 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Kennedy (1:43 PM). State objects - relevance - overruled (1:44 PM). Demars excused at 1:45 PM. State rests preserving any rebuttal issues. Jurors leave courtroom at 1:46 PM. Kennedy moves for directed verdict and dismissal of both counts but for sure dismiss of count #2 for stated reasons. Court makes ruling - denies motion for directed verdict on count #1, denies motion for directed verdict on count #2. State clarifies statement made by Kennedy. Again, Court denies directed verdict on count #2. State still preseving right to amend complaint until all testimony is in. Kennedy calls Mike Ashbeck, sworn in, for voir dire of the witness (1:55 PM). Kennedy refers to exhibit #51. Court reviews exhibit #51. Court will allow Kennedy to refer to exhibit #51 but it will not be published to the jury and Kennedy is not allowed to talk to the portion in regards to registration. Jurors enter courtroom again at 2:03 PM. Court informs jurors that the witness on the stand has already been put under oath. Direct exam by Kennedy (2:04 PM). State objects - question re-asked (2:07 PM). Kennedy offers exhibit #22. State wants the witness to answer the question first. Court receives exhibit #22 after no objections (2:09 PM). Kennedy moves for receipt of exhibit #51. Court receives exhibit #51 after no objections. Cross exam by State at 2:09 PM. State objects - speculation/irrelevant - overruled (2:13 PM). Re-direct by Kennedy at 2:16 PM. State objects - beyond scope - overruled (2:16 PM). Ashbeck excused at 2:16 PM. Recess at 2:16 PM. Back on record at 2:29 PM with jurors present. Kennedy calls Debbie Fronek. Fronek sworn in at 2:31 PM. Direct exam by State. Kennedy offers exhibit #37. Court receives exhibit #37 after no objections (2:32 PM). Kennedy moves for admission of exhibits #52, #53, #54 and #55. Court receives exhibits #52, #53, #54 and #55 after no objections (2:36 PM). Cross exam by State at 2:38 PM. Fronek excused at 2:42 PM. Kennedy calls Brianna Fronek. Fronek sworn in at 2:43 PM. Direct exam by Kennedy. Cross exam by State at 2:47 PM. Fronek excused at 2:48 PM. Kennedy offers exhibit #56. Court reviews exhibit #56. Parties stipulate to exhibit #56. Court receives exhibit #56. Jurors leave Courtroom at 2:51 PM for voir dire of Roy Trussell. Kennedy calls Roy Trussell. Trussell sworn in at 2:52 PM. Court does voir dire when the witness as he is the defendant, goes thru the defendant's right to testify collaquey. Kennedy and State have no objections to voir dire of the witness. Jurors re-enter courtroom at 2:58 PM. Direcet exam by Kennedy (2:59 PM). Kennedy offers exhibit #49. Kennedy moves for receipt of exhibit #49. Court receives after no objections (3:00 PM). Kennedy offers exhibits #28 - #34. State renews its objections on these exhibits (MIL). State objedts to exhibit #49 being published to jury by Kennedy prior to receiving Court's permission. Kennedy asks Court permission to publish #49 to jury. Court will allow exhibit #49 to be published to jury after no objections once procedure was followed. State objects to allowing the defendant the opportunity to read from exhibit. Argument heard, Court reviews exhibit #28. Court will allow the witness to read the narrative on Exhibit #28. Kennedy moves for receipt of exhibit #28. State wants to know when exhibit #28 was taken. Court receives exhibit #28 after no further objections (3:08 PM). Kennedy offers exhibit #29. Court allows defendant to read from exhibit #29 noting State's previous objections (ongoing objection). Court receives exhibit #29 after noted previous objections (3:11 PM). Kennedy offers exhibit #30. Court receives exhibit #30 after noted objections (3:17 PM). Kennedy offers exhibit #31. Court receives exhibit #31 after noted objections (3:18 PM). Kennedy offers exhibit #32. Court receives exhibit #32 after noted objections (3:17 PM). Kennedy offers exhibit #33. Court receives exhibit #33 after noted objections (3:20 PM). Kennedy offers exhibit #34. Court receives exhibit #34 after noted objections (3:22 PM). Court offers exhibit #20. Court does not receive exhibit #20. Kennedy asks court to accept exhibits #21 and #50. Court does not receive exhibits #21 and #50. State objects - relevance - overruled (3:41 PM). Kennedy offers exhibit #38, #39, #40, #41, #42, #43, #44, #45, #46. Kennedy moves for admission #38 - #46. Court receives after no objections (3:45 PM). Kennedy offers exhibit #57. State objects to admission of exhibit #57 for stated reasons. Court receives exhibit #57 (3:48 PM). Cross exam by State at 3:50 PM. Kennedy objects - argumentative - overruled (3:59 PM). Re-direct by Kennedy at 4:08 PM. Re-cross by State (4:10 PM). Re-direct by Kennedy at 4:12 PM. Trussel excused at 4:12 PM. Defense rests. State recalls Deputy Novak. Novak reminded that he is still under oath. Re-cross by Kennedy at 4:16 PM. Novak excused at 4:16 PM. State recalls Kevin Demars. Demars reminded that he is stll under oath. Direct exam by State at 4:17 PM. Re-cross by Kennedy at 4:19 PM. Demars excused at 4:19 PM. State calls Nancy Schuhart. Schuhart sworn in at 4:21 PM. Direct exam by State. Kennedy objects - irrelevant - overruled (4:22 PM). Schuhart excused at 4:23 PM. Recess at 4:23 PM. Recalled at 4:31 PM with jurors present. State calls Captain Jeff Marvin. Marvin sworn in at 4:31 PM. Direct exam by State. No cross exam. Marvin excused at 4:33 PM. Jurors leave Courtroom at 4:34 PM. State renews motion to amend count #2 to negligent. Court reads the statute referred to by State. Argument taken on amendment. Kennedy - consults with defendant (4:38 PM). Back on record at 4:42 PM with defendant and Kennedy present.
Notice of Filing of Certified Medical Records
Jury trial on July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roy D Trussell in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:31 PM. Court reviews status of case, Kennedy has filed a motion regarding double jeopardy for stated reasons. Court has received the defendant's motion and the State's reply to the motion. Kennedy has filed a rebuttal on 4/4/16 - Court has not seen that rebuttal - Kennedy provides Court with a copy of his filed rebuttal. Kennedy states motion. State has not reviewed the cite that Kennedy referenced (Hawaii Law - State vs Moriwake). Court responds and has read the filed rebuttal. Court makes a record in regards to it's opinion  on the matter. Kennedy responds. State responds and asks court to deny the motion and schedule the matter for another JT. Kennedy makes final response, asks Court to dismiss the case. Court denies motion for dismissal of the case and will set the matter for another JT. Court rules there is a manifiest necessity to re-try this case for stated reasons, puts on the record that there was a dicussion on the record of how to rectify the situation on the original day of JT, continues bond, sets for another JT. Kennedy makes statement in regards to some of his previous subpoenas for records from the FOSO Sheriff and Town of Wabeno. Court responds. Kennedy - may be calling an additional witness and will provide the State with that information.  Jury trial scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Letter Brief in Support of New Trial
Motion hearing on April 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roy D Trussell in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:15 AM. Court thanks jurors for appearing today. Clerk swears in jurors. State introduces witnesses. Court begins voir dire of jurors (9:22 AM). State begins voire dire (9:35 AM). Kennedy begins voir dire (9:53 AM). Jurors sworn in at 10:10 AM. Jurors leave room at 10:11 AM. Kennedy requests sequestration of witnesses. Court grants sequestion except for Deputy Novak. Kennedy makes statement regarding some subpoenas. Kenendy can release the subpoenas that he stated. Court deals with a juror issue. Court excuses the juror and will make a record on the issue. Kennedy asserts double jeopardy and wishes for a mis-trial and makes motion for mis-trial. Court declares mis-trial at this time and will start all over. Recess at 10:24 AM. Back on record 10:31 AM. Court instructs jurros that they are free to go today, insructs jurors that the court has declared a mis-trial at this point. Jurors excused at 10:34 AM. Back on record at 10:35 in regards to declaring mis-trial. Court not deciding issue today in regards to the dismissal of the case, requests short brief on that matter (5 pages preferrably) and State can respond. Kennedy makes statement regarding not proceeding today. State makes statement regarding the mis-trial and was willing to proceed. Court responds that the panel had already been sworn in. State wants on the record that Attorney Kennedy was given several options for proceeding today and wanted the mis-trial. Off record for scheduling. Court sets for motion hearing (double jeopardy) on 4/5/16 at 1:30 PM, Kennedy to have brief in my 3/29/16 and State has until 4/1/16 to reply and Kennedy has until 4/4/16 at noon. Kennedy wants witnesses released. Court continues bond. Adjourned at 10:49 AM.
  Motion hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roy D Trussell in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 8:29 AM. Court has one defense MIL and state's MIL. State would like to address jury instruction - 1980. Clerk dismissed to copy jury instructions, 8:32 AM. otion in regards to pre-arrest comment. Discussion on exhibit 47. Kennedy asks to mark exhibit 48 (redacted information from exhibit 47). State objects to jury instruction 1980 - negligence issue. Court advises of negligence of mistreatment of animal should not be brought up in opening statement. Can address if need be throughout the trial. State objects to some of defendant's exhibits, testimonial. Court questions Kennedy, comments written on photos by defendant. Court - agrees and will deal with them as they come up. Kennedy - states one of witness is ill and was to bring records from the town, town chairman has not provided no town records. Court will address throughout the hearing. Kennedy video/911 tapes not available. Kennedy does not object to any of the State's MIL. Short discussion on felony case. Back on the record, 8:54 AM. Court - MIL - supress discussion regarding written statement of DE - granting motion unless defendant opens the door to that subject. Kennedy indicates issues on medical records, state does not dispute them, court does not feel medical records should be entered into evidence.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance - BRP
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance - AMM
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance - CMG
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance - NCR
Trial Management Letter - from Attorney Kennedy
follow up to PTC by defendant

Defendant Roy D Trussell in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not called on the record. The matter is currently set for a one-day JT. State has approximately 4-8 witnesses. Kennedy has comment in regards to the records from Wabeno Muncipal Court. State responds. Discussion on complete discovery. Both parties believe that the case will only take one day, begin at 8:30 AM, Court will allow note taking. State to look to see if there is any in-squad video of the ride in the squad car. Discussion on medical records of the defendant, provided to state in Court by Kennedy. State wants to know if the defendant was on medications at the time of the incident. MIL will be at 8:30 AM. Kennedy has provided a proposed jury instruction and parties are to get any other unique jury instructions to the Court prior to the JT. Kennedy will be renewing original motion.

Pre-trial conference at 03-08-2016 01:15 pm.
Jury trial at 03-22-2016 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert A Kennedy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:00 PM. Court - here for oral ruling on Kennedy's motion to dismiss the case for stated reasons. Court gives recap of case and reads oral ruling - denies defendant's motion but has addressed all of the arguments that the defendant has made. Court continues bond, sets for JT on 3/22/16 and sets for PTC on 3/8/16.  Jury trial scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
State's i opposition to dfendant's motions to dismiss

Defendant is not to possess any hand guns, may possess 2 long guns for deer/bird hunting purposes only, all other guns must be surrendered to Forest County Sheriff Department by 6:00 p.m. today, 11/6/15, will reserve the right to modify whom guns are surrened to, no contact with DeMars family or their property

Defendant Roy D Trussell in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:13 PM.  Kennedy would like to vacate the bond due to the fact that bond was set prior to substitution. State - updates the court on bond situation and the reason for DA's position on increased bond. State - requesting bond to remain. Kennedy makes statement in regards to bond. Court - vacates prior bond and will establishe a new bond, court questions defendant, sets $250 cash with conditions of not to possess any hand guns, may possess 2 long guns for deer/bird hunting purposes only, all other guns must be surrendered to Forest County Sheriff Department by 6:00 p.m. today, 11/6/15, will reserve the right to modify whom guns are surrened to, no contact with DeMars family or their property. Remaining bond may be refunded to poster. Proceed to ARGN. Kennedy has received a copy of the INFO and waives further reading, and enters NG pleas to both counts. Court accepts plea. Kennedy has filed a Motion to Dismiss. State to file a response brief on or before 12/3/15, Kennedy will have until 12/10/15 to reply. Court schedules an Oral Ruling Hearing - Rhode to appear via video all other parties to appear in person in Forest County.  Oral ruling scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Supplement to motion to dismiss filed by defendant

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: No consumption of alcohol, no contact or enter onto any property of DeMars, no possession of firearms, must be surrendered to Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Roy D Trussell in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:17 a.m. Kennedy would like to proceed and would like sequestration. Court orders sequestration. State calls deputy Jason Novak, sworn in 9:18 AM, state directs. Kennedy object overruled (9:23 am) Witness identifies defendant (9:25 am) Kennedy cross examines (9:28 AM). State - objection- sustained, (9:29 AM), 3 objections by State - all sustained. State - objection - over ruled (9:30 AM). Kennedy offers exhibit #1 (officer's report) given to Kennedy by witness (9:32 AM). State - objects - sustained (9:32 AM). State objects - sustained (9:33 AM). Kennedy moves to receive exhibit. Court accepts exhibit one. Kennedy - files substitution of judge. State questions bond. State would like to re-address bond and asks for $1000 cash and no possesion of firearms. Kennedy opposes. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State files information (mirrors). Court amends bond to $1000 cash, no consumption of alcohol, no contact with or to enter onto any property of the DeMars, no possession of firearms, must be surrendered to Sheriff's Department. Court will accept substitution of judge.
No contact in any matter of form with the victim (N.D. and K.D.).

Defendant Roy D Trussell in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:15 AM. Trussell and Kennedy have complaint, waives reading, wants PH, will waive time limits and have filed a Memorandum. State - $250.00 cash, no contact with victim and not to be at their address/residence. Kennedy wants clarification of the no contact provision, no objections. Court - bond - $250.00 cash, no contact in any matter of form with the victim (N.D. and K.D.). Court sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
